page.title: 11Cornwood School
page.content: Cornwood,mentioned in the Domesday Book as Cornehuda,a manor,has approx. 1OOO souls(this number not having altered much over the years) In 1859 a church school was erected in the centre of the village,by the Rev. Duke Yonge. The school has undergone many changes,including the incorporation of the attached headmaster's house into the school,and the building of a swimming pool in the school garden. Today the school has 3 classes:infants lower and upper juniors, and a total of between 7O-8O pupils. Some children are bused in from nearby Lee Moor, where the local school recently closed.After many years of protest and letter-writing the school's outdoor toilets are to be rebuilt and attached to the main building by a covered way. Cornwood school serves the Ivybridge Comprehensive/Community College.
